abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            while project sustainability is likely. World Bank
            performance is assessed as unsatisfactory, despite the sheer
            difficulty of successfully implementing projects in
            Tajikistan. Also depsite the genuine commitment that the
            supervision team made to ensure that the project was
            implemented according to World Bank guidelines and with
            maximum community participation, there was a failure to
            resolve sufficiently quickly the extremely tense
            relationship between the World Bank and the Government,
            especially in year 2000. Borrower performance is rated
            unsatisfactory for two reasons: 1) the persistent problem of
            inadequate counterpart funding, and 2) the Government's
            failure to follow an appropriate selection procedure for the
            new Executive Director of the Social Investment Fund in Year
            2000, the appointment of an Executive Director without the
            Bank's approval, and the refusal of the Government for
            several months to correct the situation through an
            acceptable selection process. Some of the lessons learned
            were: High-level and sustained borrower commitment is of
            utmost importance. Continuing fiscal continuity facing the
            country inevitably cause difficulties for the Government in
            making available sufficient counterpart funds for
            IDA-supported funds in Tajikistan. Political interference
            has to be avoided especially when appointing key TASIF
            staff. The TASIF needs strong management and leadership, and
            training is critically important.
